text: The parties are required to conference in person, by telephone, or by
label: BODY

text: any other means on which they may agree.  A Board interlocutory
label: BODY

text: attorney or administrative trademark judge will participate in the
label: BODY

text: conference, upon request of any party, provided that such participation
label: BODY

text: is requested no later than ten (10) days prior to the deadline for the
label: BODY

text: conference.  See Trademark Rule 2.120(a)(2).  The request for Board
label: BODY

text: participation must be made through the Electronic System for Trademark
label: BODY

text: Trials and Appeals (ESTTA) or by telephone call to the interlocutory
label: BODY

text: attorney assigned to the case, whose name can be found by referencing
label: BODY

text: the TTABVUE record for this case at http://ttabvue.uspto.gov/ttabvue/.  The
label: BODY

text: parties should contact the assigned interlocutory attorney or file a
label: BODY

text: request for Board participation through ESTTA only after the parties
label: BODY

text: have agreed on possible dates and times for their conference.
label: BODY

text: Subsequent participation of a Board attorney or judge in the conference
label: BODY

text: will be by telephone and the parties shall place the call at the agreed
label: BODY

text: date and time, in the absence of other arrangements made with the
label: BODY

text: assigned interlocutory attorney.
label: BODY

text: The Board's Standard Protective Order is applicable to this case, but
label: HH1

text: the parties may agree to supplement that standard order or substitute a
label: HH3

text: protective agreement of their choosing, subject to approval by the
label: HH3

text: Board.  The standard order is available for viewing at:
label: HH3

text: http://www.uspto.gov/trademarks/process/appeal/guidelines/stndagmnt.jsp.  Any party
label: HH3

text: without access to the web may request a hard copy of the standard order
label: BODY

text: from the Board.  The standard order does not automatically protect a
label: BODY

text: party's confidential information and its provisions must be utilized as
label: BODY

text: needed by the parties.  See Trademark Rule 2.116(g).
label: BODY

text: Information about the discovery phase of the Board proceeding is
label: HH1

text: available in chapter 400 of the TBMP.  By virtue of amendments to the
label: HH3

text: Trademark Rules effective November 1, 2007, the initial disclosures and
label: HH3

text: expert disclosures scheduled during the discovery phase are required
label: HH3

text: only in cases commenced on or after that date.  The TBMP has not yet
label: HH3

text: been amended to include information on these disclosures and the
label: BODY

text: parties are referred to the August 1, 2007 Notice of Final Rulemaking
label: BODY

text: (72 Fed. Reg. 42242) posted on the Board's webpage.  The deadlines for
label: BODY

text: pretrial disclosures included in the trial phase of the schedule for
label: BODY

text: this case also resulted from the referenced amendments to the Trademark
label: BODY

text: Rules, and also are discussed in the Notice of Final Rulemaking.
label: BODY

text: The parties must note that the Board allows them to utilize telephone
label: HH1

text: conferences to discuss or resolve a wide range of interlocutory matters
label: HH3

text: that may arise during this case.  In addition, the assigned
label: HH3

text: interlocutory attorney has discretion to require the parties to
label: BODY

text: participate in a telephone conference to resolve matters of concern to
label: BODY

text: the Board.  See TBMP § 502.06(a) (2d ed. rev. 2004).
label: BODY

text: The TBMP includes information on the introduction of evidence during
label: HH2

text: the trial phase of the case, including by notice of reliance and by
label: HH3

text: taking of testimony from witnesses.  See TBMP §§ 703 and 704.  Any
label: HH3

text: notice of reliance must be filed during the filing party's assigned
label: BODY

text: testimony period, with a copy served on all other parties.  Any
label: BODY

text: testimony of a witness must be both noticed and taken during the
label: BODY

text: party's testimony period.  A party that has taken testimony must serve
label: BODY

text: on any adverse party a copy of the transcript of such testimony,
label: BODY

text: together with copies of any exhibits introduced during the testimony,
label: BODY

text: within thirty (30) days after the completion of the testimony
label: BODY

text: deposition.  See Trademark Rule 2.125.
label: BODY

label: HH1

text: (b).  An oral hearing after briefing is not required but will be
label: HH3

text: scheduled upon request of any party, as provided by Trademark Rule
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: proceeding become) parties in another Board proceeding or a civil
